places.title: Island Vintage Coffee
places.description: Pretty good. I think this one is tied for first with Crispy Grindz. My favorite is the liliko'i moana bowl. The honey is what makes it work.

places.title: Crispy Grindz
places.description:
Despite the unconvincing name, the acai here is really good. The acai base is not blended with other junk. I like to get it with honey and extra granola.

The non-acai menu items are okay but not special.

places.title: Angel's Ice Cream
places.description: The shaved ice was fine. The real star is the Ube Milkshake. So creamy. So ube-y. Very good.

places.title: Climbworks
places.description: I did not expect to enjoy this (ziplining) as much as I did. It's pretty fun! A little terrifying to start.

places.title: Japanese Food Truck No. 7
places.description: Pretty good for food truck food. Sometimes I crave udon so this place hits the spot.

places.title: Matsumoto Shave Ice
places.description: It's simple but good.

places.title: Mitch's Fish Market
places.description: It's not bad - the nigiri is fine. The hand rolls were quite good. Apparently Obama has been here.

places.title: Da Shop
places.description: Cute, small bookshop.

places.title: Kona Coffee Purveyors
places.description: The coffee is fine. The gem is that they serve pastries from b. patisserie. The kouign amann is quite good.

places.title: Maguro Spot
places.description: My first impression back in july was very good. After spending a month sampling all sorts of poke in hawaii, I have to revise my opinion. It's not bad, but not the best. Flavors just aren't fully present.

places.title: Musubi Cafe Iyasume
places.description: Great spam musubi. I like the regular kind.

places.title: Opal Thai
places.description: Kind of cool. The head chef takes a survey on what the table likes and doesn't like and makes food from there. He's very opinionated.

places.title: Paalaa Kai Bakery
places.description: The signature pastry is the Snow Puffy. Worth a try.

places.title: Poke for the People
places.description: Pretty good poke, though not anything special.

places.title: Rental Car
places.description:
Transit more or less doesn't exist. There's _The Bus_, but service is infrequent and inconvenient.

Unless you're exclusively doing things in Waikiki, getting a car seems to be an unfortunate necessity.

places.title: Sushi Maru
places.description: I recall this being good, though I'm writing this 6 months after the fact. Atmosphere was pretty relaxed and I remember enjoying talking with the chef.

places.title: Tonkatsu Ginza Bairin
places.description: Delicious, but you do need a reservation. We got the specialty pork katsu which was quite good.

places.title: Yamada Chikara
places.description:
Everything is delicious and the stream of food feels never ending. Come with an empty stomach.

Sadly, it looks like this spot closed for good recently.

places.title: Aweoweo Beach
places.description:
Kind of hidden, though we happened to live behind this beach. When the waves aren't rough, it's really good for snorkeling.

I consistently see a family of sea turtles here, so I'm not sure why anybody is [causing a traffic jam at Laniakea](https://www.hawaiimagazine.com/laniakea-beach-on-oahus-north-shore-may-soon-have-a-temporary-fix-for-traffic/).

places.title: Banzai Bowls
places.description: The bowl is massive but sadly, not very good. Tasted more like an apple juice smoothie than anything else. Ratio of acai puree to other toppings is off.

places.title: Don Quixote
places.description:
Your one-stop shop for anything you could possible need on a trip. It's like a Japanese Wal-mart.

The only bad thing I can say about this place is that they don't play the [theme song](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1zl88Aieecw&t=45s).

places.title: Fooki
places.description: The pork belly rice and the beef scallion noodles were really good. Other dishes were a miss.

places.title: Haleiwa Bowls
places.description: It's okay. The bowls are slightly on the bigger side. I tried both the mana and hapa bowls, but both kind of tasted like juice.

places.title: Hanauma Bay
places.description:
A bit of a hassle to get into. You need timed-entry tickets a couple days beforehand.

Beach itself is nice but rather crowded. You can see a lot of fish here. A lot of families come here it seems.

places.title: Honolulu Museum of Art
places.description: Kind of neat art museum. I liked the contemporary exhibitions and the courtyards are nice to stroll through.

places.title: Izakaya Pau Hana Base
places.description: It's not bad, but not super special. The mackerel was pretty good.

places.title: Maguro Bros
places.description: Really delicous. Possibly my favorite place for poke. The flavors are simple and delicious. Apparently, the owners used to work at the fish market in Tokyo.

places.title: Marukai Market
places.description: Apparently it's owned by Donki too. There's an expansive ready-to-eat food section. Nothing in particular is outstanding, but it's all not bad. Good variety.

places.title: McDonald's
places.description: Yes, it's just McDonald's. But they have some Hawaiian specialty items! We had the Saimin (kind of like instant ramen with a seafood broth maybe?) and a breakfast plate (rice! and sausages). Not amazing but worth a try.

places.title: Sunrise Shack
places.description: Not very good. The acai is blended and doesn't taste like acai.

places.title: Sushi Sho
places.description: Unfortunately, I haven't eaten at the restaurant yet - it seems hard to get into. They sell takeout bento boxes though, that are quite good.

places.title: Zippy's
places.description: Apparently this is a Hawaiian staple. I thought it would be fast food but feels more like a diner.

places.title: I-naba
places.description: The soba is really good. I think it tops [Sobaya](../nyc/) in both texture and flavor. The restaurant is BYOB, if you're into that.

places.title: Ka'ena Point
places.description:
Western-most point on Oahu. It's a 2-3 mile hike that's relatively flat and along the beach. We went on the first day after a rainy spell, so the ground was a bit muddy.

Sunset is really neat, but you end up walking back in the dark for an hour or so. I'd recommend a flash light.

places.title: Makapu'u Point Lighthouse Trail
places.description: Fun for a sunrise hike. I'd say you want to get there ~30 minutes before sunrise for best results. The gate to the parking lot opens at 7am, but you can park outside the gate anyways.

places.title: Nisshodo
places.description:
Tasty mochi treats. We got one of everything and sampled for a few days.

The store keeps weird hours, so I'd recommend calling ahead. (We came here on 4 separate occasions and only successfully purchased mochi once.)

places.title: Shingen Soba Izakaya
places.description: Not bad, but not my favorite. Soba doesn't compare against I-naba. For what it's worth, Niki worked here in _Terrace House_, but the location has moved since then.

places.title: Waiamea Valley
places.description: It's more of a botanical garden than anything else. Nice to stroll through, but kind of pricey ($20/per) for what it is.

places.title: Duke's Food Hall
places.description: It's a big food hall with a few different shops. In particular, the mochi malasada is good (and sometimes runs out).

places.title: Machete's Mean Sandwiches
places.description: A refreshingly simple, but tasty sandwich. I like that they use plain sliced white bread.

acai.description: I didn't think I liked acai bowls, but Yolanda took me to enough of them that I formed an opinion.
